page.title: 01West Harting
page.content: Land - The salient feature to the south of this area in Torberry Hill - pronounced locally as Tarberry. Most of the country is intensively farmed. Mainly arable, with each farm running a moderate size dairy herd and store lambs. There is also a grass drying plant for animal feed on the south west boundary. West Heath common, on the northern bounary, is being worked as a sandpit. The low lying woods, enclosing a small pond, on the north eastern boundary of the area are being developed as a 'wet land'. People - the area is sparcely populated, half the residents being invovled in farming. Because of mechanization many of the farm cottages have been converted and sold to retired professional people.
